item.title: [Pi] DSPK help resetdef
item.dc:creator: @Sir_Jay Sir Jay
item.description:
@Sir_Jay wrote:

my bad I had mine at the end of the method so I had an extra brace, make yours

        if (playerCommand.equalsIgnoreCase("resetdef")) {
               if (c.playerLevel[1] <= 50) {
            	   c.playerLevel[1] = 1;
            	   c.playerLevel[1] = c.getLevelForXP(playerXP[1]);
            	   } else {
            		   c.sendMessage("You cannot reset your defence if it is higher than 50!");
            		   }
               }

Read full topic

if (playerCommand.equalsIgnoreCase("guild")) { c.sendMessage("You can fish sharks here!"); c.getPA().startTeleport(2603, 3403, 0, "modern"); { if (playerCommand.equalsIgnoreCase("resetdef")) { if (c.playerLevel[1] <= 50) { c.playerLevel[1] = 1; c.playerLevel[1] = c.getLevelForXP(playerXP[1]); } else { c.sendMessage("You cannot reset your defence if it is higher than 50!"); } } } if (playerCommand.equalsIgnoreCase("clanpk")) { c.sendMessage("clan wars/pk trips"); c.getPA().startTeleport(3277, 3881, 0, "modern"); }

item.title: [Pi] DSPK help resetdef
item.dc:creator: @Sir_Jay Sir Jay
item.description:
@Sir_Jay wrote:

Does PI have a getLevelForXP method? IDK but heres how i’d do it untested:

        if (playerCommand.equalsIgnoreCase("resetdef")) {
               if (c.playerLevel[1] <= 50) {
            	   c.playerLevel[1] = 1;
            	   c.playerLevel[1] = c.getLevelForXP(playerXP[1]);
            	   } else {
            		   c.sendMessage("You cannot reset your defence if it is higher than 50!");
            		   }
               }
	}

Read full topic

item.title: [Pi] DSPK help resetdef
item.dc:creator: @xocean xocean
item.description:
@xocean wrote:

Well i have this resetdef command

if (playerCommand.equalsIgnoreCase("resetdef")) { if (c.playerLevel[1] <= 50) { c.playerLevel[1] = 1; } else { c.sendMessage("You cannot reset your defence if it is higher than 50!"); } }
But i get no error etc but when i login and do ::Resetdef it dont reset it just puts my level to 2.

Let’s say i had 20 def i do ::Resetdef it gives me 2/20 like a brew… after awhile regains back to 20

Read full topic
